鼦字的基本解释

鼦
diāo
古同“貂”：“狐鼦裘千皮。”

鼦字的汉语字典释义

[①]［diāo］
［《廣韻》都聊切，平蕭，端。］
亦作“鼦1”。
(1)哺乳动物。形似鼬，身体细长，四肢短，尾粗，毛长，呈黄色或紫黑色。其毛皮极珍贵，可制衣裘，御寒性能极好。
(2)指貂皮。
(3)指貂皮制成的衣裘。
(4)指貂尾，古代多用作帝王贵近之臣的冠饰。
(5)借指侍中、常侍等官。
(6)姓。《战国策·齐策六》有貂勃。

鼦字的康熙字典解释
鼦字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
鼦字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
Numb
diāo
Gu Tong "Mink": "Fox Man Fur Thousand Skins."
Numb
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［diāo］
["Guangyun" all talk and cut, Pingxiao, Duan. ]
Also known as "Nan 1".
(1) Mammals. It resembles a ferret, with a slender body, short limbs, a thick tail, and long hair, which is yellow or purple-black. Its fur is extremely precious, can be made into garments, and has excellent resistance to cold.
(2) Refers to mink fur.
(3) Refers to clothing fur made of mink fur.
(4) Refers to the sable tail, which was often used as a crown decoration for emperors and courtiers in ancient times.
(5) By referring to officials such as Shizhong and Changshi.
(6) Last name. "The Sixth Policy of the Warring States Period: Qi Ce" has a stupid vigor.
